I had to start a new entry because the other one was getting too long....so yeah. Same rules still apply: read only if you don't care about spoilers.


Oliver!--1969                              (5/17/2007)
                     Started out good i suppose...tho' i started watching side 2 first cause the dvd is labled wrong....stupid dvd...yeah...a little confused. anyway...liked the song about food and such...tho' there were alot of cheesy kids who were overacting...it was a little irritating...but whatever. oliver is just too cute. so gamine...is that the right word? either way....i liked all the sets/costumes...very nice. As far as the musical numbers went, i thought all of them were waaaaaay to long. Mostly because i got the point of what they were trying to say about 30 seconds into the song....and yet they all dragged on endlessly....repeating the same chorus again and again and again. give me a break and write something else for them to sing. I thought that Bill Sikes guy was a little creepy. especially when he opened the mail slot..ewwwww. and i couldn't decided whether i thought the artful dodger was cute or not? he's just like that girl in gigi....sometimes cute and other times not. but whatever....i didn't really understand why sometimes oliver would fight back and then other times he could be like the biggest wimp ever. stupid. i don't think that i would have wanted to live back then...just thinking about how dirty everone was gives me the creeps a little.....so dirty! bugs! no thanks. i like soap, thank you very much.  watching them made me want to tell them to take baths or something....all of them were so filthy. yech. i suppose that i would watch this one again...probably not for awhile though.

Midnight Cowboy--1970                           (5/18/2007)
                       I really am too spoiled. i don't think that i could live in squalor like that. too much of a princess. I wasn't sure what to think of John Voight as a hustler....i thought he was a little funny looking back then...he looked weird to me because i'm used to seeing the older john voight. so yeah. i wouldn't have payed him for any services rendered. ehh. even dustin hoffman looked a little weird to me....i dunno why....plus i kept getting rain man flashes. not to mention he is always really dirty looking in the movie....eww. take a bath man. i wonder how he hurt his foot? i can't remember if he mentioned it or not......either way.....i thought that the cinematography in this film was excellent. Very interesting to watch...plus i liked that they made all the flashbacks/dream sequences in black and white...i wonder if this was the first film to do that? hmh. i thought that the acting was very well done also. But i thought that the storyline got a little weird every once in awhile....mostly toward the end. but i think that was mostly around the drug induced party scenes....oh and by the way...that lady in the beginning...so NOT 28! she looked more like 38. and definitely not hot either. i did like that scene with the remote though. crafty. i dont't know that this is something i would or could watch on a regular basis though...too many things creep/bum me out. I was glad to have watched it tho'.

Patton--1971                              (6/17/2007)
                  Oh, jeez what a snoozefest. I really didn't want to watch this one.....and yeah i wasn't pleasantly surprised after watching it either....maybe this is just another godfather moment but i just didn't get this one. Boring! I think that the only reason this one won is because of the beginning and the acting of George C. Scott.....oh and maybe the music. but yeah....i just got bored watching this one...not to mention that Patton is an egoistical nut. He is crazy! You know i think that the war might have turned out differently had he been allowed to run free. I only say that because of that Nazi guy who knew everything about him, and was only stopped from helping because they didn't really listen to him. If they had they might have been able to win more of the battles. But i mean that's coming from someone who has no real idea about the actual history. Yeah...didn't really go that in depth in high school. And  I'm not really sure how to feel about the whole coward thing....on the one hand i understand where that slap came from...on the other hand.....yeah. not so much. Anyway...i really don't think that i am going to be watching this one again. No, no no. Maybe only if tempted and bribed with money or ice cream.

The French Connection--1972                                (6/20/2007)
                    uhhh....yeah. crazy gene hackman! what was going on with his character?! What a nut! crazy nut. i almost felt a little bad for roy schieder. anyway...this one tho' more interesting than patton, was a little boring too. It was nicely composed and had some nice lighting, and yet...it really wasn't enough for me to enjoy watching. Plus i didn't really like the way it ended...i mean well i liked that very end with the gunshot and blackout...but i didn't really like all those what-happened-to-who deal. I think that's mostly due to the fact that the one actor guy got the worst sentence out of all of them and he''s the one who participated the least. That just seems way too typical to me. Maybe it was a new idea back then, but when i see it now...i just think lame. Plus that other guy just got away...uh okay. Not to mention that gene hackman's character didn't even seem to get reprimanded for killing that Federal guy. I mean i know that he and his partner got taken of Narcotics cases but still...from the way that Fed guy was talking...it's not something he hadn't done before. I kinda saw him as a vigilante cop. Not to mention obsessive. But yeah.....by the middle i was kinda just waiting for the movie to end. I kinda got irritated watching that popeye doyle guy too. And how in the world was he able to pick up that chick on the bike? Sooo not hot. smooth talker maybe? i dunno. either way, ewww. And what was up with all the random shots of that hat in the back seat of their car?  And please...that blood was sooo fake looking. way too orangey and watery. not to mention that when that guy got "shot" in that face in the beginning....not a very good special effects job. I know i sound kinda harsh...and have to take into consideration that it was made in the the early seventies...but still, c'mon. i did kinda like the train/car chase scene tho'. But all i kept thinking through that was...oh poor guy. Gene Hackman just went and totally fucked up your shit. That bastard.

The Godfather--1973                      (2005-i think)
                     Boys and their pseudo-masculine movies. ehh. i think that overall the story was interesting and all, but i still found it a little boring. maybe i didn't give it much of a chance or something? i dunno either way i really didn't see what the big deal was. not to mention that i thought Marlon Brando was going to be in the movie longer than he was.

The Sting--1974                       (6/24/2007)
                             Oh, for daays robert redford. You know i actually found this one kinda boring. I mean i sorta already knew what was going to happen before it actually did. robert redford didn't even need to put those squibs in his mouth.....well okay i fell for that whole...female assassin thing, but everything else...seen it....maybe that's my problem....i've already seen this whole movie re-made and so nothing was a real surprise. i did like the song though...i wonder if it was written for this movie? huh...i'm supposing that it was...anywho...yeah...at about half way though i got antsy and was just waiting for the sting to happen already. i did like the various cutaways and the ending with the round closing shot...and i liked some of the lighting and the cinematography. i just didn't really see anything that would make me want to watch this one again. Well i mean besides robert redford and paul newman.

The Godfather II-1975                     (2005--right after #1)
                  Ditto for this one. Meeh.

One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest--1976                     (1999--for an English Lit. Class)
                   I don't really remember much of this one...only that scene at the end where the indian guy is talking to a lobotomized jack nicholson. i think i mostly remember it as being weird and jack nicholson as being creepy. cause really he kinda is.

Rocky--1977                         (Sometime in the mid-90's)
                       i think that the only thing i can remember about this one is why would adrian even want to get involved with a meathead like rocky? granted he's got a heart of gold...but still a meathead. i'm supposing it was lack of options...but i dunno. i mean i liked the movie. i though that the beginning was a little slow and boring...but overall i thought that it was good. i mean i actually like sylvester stallone.....i will admit to having seen most of his movies. even the specialist. yeah i know. bad. but whatever. i attribute that entirely to sharon stone.

Annie Hall--1978                   (6/24/2007)
                             From the moment this started i was already dreading it...and i thought that it would be a nice brake from all the war and death....yeah not so much. i mean it totally had it's moments...parts of it i really liked....it's just all that incessant chattering. so not a fan of woody allen. That entire beginning monologue made me want to turn it off.....i really just don't see the attraction. i mean look at all those people that character hooked up with....so not for me. But then again they were all a little neurotic and unbalanced...so what does that say about him really. Still i do wonder if this one was the first to use first person perspective? that whole talking to the camera bit......i'm assuming that it was...but i'll research later. anywho...yeah...i really didn't think that any of his jokes were very funny either......so comedian? not so much. i did like how there was the internal monologue though...i wonder if this was the first one to do that too? at first i was a little confused about that cause i was watching with subtitles...so yeah. i also love that colleen dewhurst was in this. I love her! anne of green gables, you know. and christopher walken too...love him. i did like that whole split screen conversation at the dinner table and at the analysts office. I can see why this one won the best picture oscar..i just don't know if i want to get past woody allen to watch it again.

The Deer Hunter--1979                                (6/29/2007)
                            Uh..yeah. not so much. i really do like christopher walken though. I...uh...i dunno. I really think that this one won just because it was about vietnam. it was good enough i suppose.....in terms off cinematography, lighting and story...i just....i don't know. I don't really feel any urge to watch it again...once was enough for me. maybe i would appreciate it more if it had had more of an impact on my life....i mean i wasn't even born yet. It did keep on giving me Miss Saigon flashes though.....i was listening to that the other day and i still think that chris guy was a selfish ass. It made me mad just listening to it....anyway...yeah that whole russian roulette thing...i really don't think that i could do that...scary! i was just wondering if there was a reason that they were all russian too? was it supposed to coincide with the whole roulette thing? You know...i was a little surprised that robert de niro's character waited that long to go back for him. i would have thought that he would have stayed there till he found him....especially since he promised. instead he waited what seemed like months...way too long. and he must have known what he was doing while he was there....i mean really. so that i didn't get. Plus i wasn't really sure what was going on with that whole meryl streep/robert de niro/christopher walken triangle.....she was obviously attracted to robert de niro and vice versa.....so yeah. i'm not sure how i feel about her and him hooking up when he gets back either....i mean i can understand the comfort thing....but really. isn't that sorta a betrayal? anyway...and yeah ohmigod the end! with the singing! i think that i would have liked the movie a whole lot more if it hadn't ended with the God Bless America. cheesy. and not in the good way. But then again i am not one of those uber patriotic people either...so yeah. either way...i really didn't see what the big deal was. but then i could say that about alot of the movies i've watched.

Kramer Vs. Kramer--1981                      (mid-90's)
                       i remember the part when the kid gets taken to the hospital. that's about it...oh and that meryl streep looked kinda old.....other than that....not much.

Ordinary People--1982                        (7/5/2007)
                          Uh......okay. yeah. Maybe i am just an insensitive bastard...but i kinda gotta say....and? i kinda felt like i was waiting two hours for the 5 lousy seconds at the end. this movie to me was just way too predictable and a little bit boring. maybe at the time it was an innovative breakthrough....but i was just kinda reminded of Good Will Hunting a little.....and i'm not really sure how i feel about the use of pachelbel's canon at the beginning of the film...or was it not a wedding song at the time? if not well then okay. i mean i do really like the song....but it's basically synonymous with weddings. anywho.....i really didn't like mary tyler moore's character in this film. what an unfeeling bitch...i really don't think that people like that should be allowed to have children. i mean they ultimately just screw them up anyway, and i totally felt major sympathy for the men in her life.....poor bastards. um....so yeah. bored. and i dunno...i wasn't really that moved by the whole discovery of why the son hated himself....maybe cause i knew what it was before he did. yeah you can tell that i've never really had any major tragedy in my life.....otherwise i don't think that i would be so blase about the whole thing.....at this point in my life i can't really help it. i am drama free. so yeah. really don't think that i will be watching this one again....maybe i will when i have a better "life" understanding of it all. 

Chariots Of Fire--1983                           (mid-90's)
                    The song is the only thing i really remember from this one, and the beach running.

Ghandi--1983                               (7/8/2007)
                    I was very happy to find out that ben kingsley was at least half indian....cause otherwise it would have been black face all over again and that really would have been tragic. not to mention i think, a little bit insulting and degrading. anywho....yeah...i don't think that any of those other films nominated that year....E.T., Missing, Tootsie, The Verdict............had any real chance of winning...i mean were talking about Gandhi here. Not to say anything about richard attenborough's skills or anything but i mean really if you make any sort of effort and are backed with a considerable amount of money...there is no way that Gandhi could lose. Personally, i thought that the movie was okay. Cinematography-ok, acting was great...and i'm sure that helped....but overall...okay. I actually got a little bored toward the middle end of the whole thing....maybe i would have liked it more if i was more aware of Gandhi's teachings....but i really don't have any idea except for the whole non-violence thing and the fasting....plus being ignorant of history i kinda didn't like that they didn't explain why that guy shot him....i'm thinking that maybe it was a muslim? but i dunno. i also didn't really like that the years went by so vaguely. it was always a few years later, a few months later, etc. plus that whole beginning scene where he gets shot...had a weird sort of feeling for me.....almost like it was anti-climatical or something......i dont' really know how to explain.......anyway...yeah. i can see why this one won...i just don't think it's one of those i really want to watch again.
 
Terms Of Endearment--1984                      (7/9/2007)
                          uHmmmm...yeah. I suppose that i liked it.i dont' really know what to say about this one....i mean....hmh. Her getting sick at the end was a little surprising....it almost felt...i dunno. i found it a little weird. i did really like that scene where she was telling her kids that she wasn't going to be around anymore though. I hope that if my kids are that young and i'm dying, that our conversation can be so candid. plus i like that she told her oldes that it was okay to not feel guilty. That's the only part in the movie that i really got all teary. I did really like jack nicholson's character too...he was charming in a kooky/kind creepy way. and man shirley mcclaine's character was such a nut..i mean you could tell that from the beginning when she makes the daughter cry....The relationship between the mother and daughter was a little new for me.....cause my mom's not really that kind. so, yeah. it was nice to see that they had such a great relationship...and i did really like that part where the daughter says that they don't fight all the fime...it's just that the mom is never satisfied with her. i laughed. anyway yeah....so i dunno. i suppose that i can see why it won....it had great acting in it...and i liked the overall cinematography.....i dunno...i suppose i could see myself watching it again...if i was in the right mood. Man, i kinda feel that all the movies i've been watching lately have been such a downer. so serious and everyting.....sigh.

Amadeus--1985                           (1992?)
                        I remember loving this movie! and hating what's his name...the guy who was trying to steal Mozart's work.....well whatever....Mozart was a genius! an idiot but a genius.

Out Of Africa--1986                      (7/21/2007)
                            Meeh. It was okay. It reminded me a little of Planet Earth....so i suppose that i liked it for the cinematography....other than that...i dunno. i was a little thrown off by meryl streph's accent...and that i couldn't really see myself getting married to my friend like that....weird. anywho...yeah...i dunno what to say really...i was a little bored by the whole thing....it was good enough. anyway....the only part that i was really moved by was when she said that she wanted to hear that guy speak her name....i teared a little then....but that's it...and i'm not really sure if agree with that whole we don't belong to anyone thing.....i can see how that makes sense and how it doesn't. Either way...i don't really have any pressing urge to watch this one again...i do admire that lady for living in a man's world and surviving....but....i don't need to be watching it on a regular basis.

Platoon--1987                               (7/23/2007)
                     um....yeah...i kinda feel the same way about all war movies....good but not something i like to watch on a regular basis. i don't think that being as young as i am and as untouched as war as you can get...be able to fully appreciate war movies...i mean i haven't and don't know anyone who has died or been sent to war. so not a personal subject. anyway...as far as this movie goes...i knew that barnes was going to kill......willem defoe's charcter...tho' i wasn't sure if chris was going to kill barnes....that was a little surprising....i also didn't really like when that guy.....the black guy who fell asleep on duty....was okay with the raping...but not with the murdering.....that just seemed a little hypocritical to me.....like one isn't as wrong as the other or something....i'm glad that scene wasn't too graphic..i think seeing that sort of thing is more traumatizing to me than seeing someone dying. I suppose that's cause i've seen millions of people die on screen...some of them have even made me laugh...which thinking about now, really shouldn't be that funny. anyway....i did like that one part in the end where it goes from black and white to color..and i did like the cinematography. The acting was great too....and it was nice seeing johnny depp. Watching this movie made me really glad that i've never lived in a country torn by war...all those poor people. innocent bystanders really. i think that i felt sorry for them the most....it also made me realize that i don't really know why those troops had to be sent to vietnam in the first place...that could just be because of my sadly lacking education tho'. we weren't taught much in the way of history.

The Last Emperor--1988                        (7/27-29/2007)
                        It took me three days to finish watching this one....for daaaaaaays! ohmigod! 3 3/4 hours is just waaaaaaaaaaaay too long. i....i.....i dunno....it was just too long. i almost couldn't stand it. what is it with all these uber long epic movies?! i swear even thought this second list of movies is shorter in terms of the number that i still have to watch, i think it's taking me the same amount of time to watch them as i did with the first set....i think cause it's filled with movies that are waaaay too long and of a subject matter that just utterly depresses me. it almost makes it too hard to appreciate. anywho....i can see why this one won i suppose..i mean the costumes and sets and cinematography are fantastic...and the acting is great too. i just kinda see this one as another gandhi though...i mean how is it going to lose really? i mean they obviously had loads of money. so yeah...that little boy in the beginning is just too too cute. he kinda reminded me of one of my friends kids. though what was with that lady wet-nursing him for that long? weird, twisted and disturbing. anywho...other than this one being too long....i had kinda wanted to see it with the dialogue in chinese....was it actually filmed that way and i just watched a dubbed version? it that's the case...well that's my bad...but if that's how it's filmed...well that's just plain stupid. i prefer the subtitles to the dubbing...just like i prefer widescreen to p&s......they really shouldn't make p&s anymore...i think it's retarded. anywho....i really don't see myself watching this one again...not even if someone else wanted too....and it doesn't really make me want to see any of the director's other films. i did think that the actor who played the adult emperor was very attractive though...and it was fun to see those other actors from one of my favorite movies of all time...Big Trouble in Little China. i love that show.

Rain Man--1989                       (1989--maybe)
                        you can forget about tom cruise...this movie is all about Dustin Hoffman. he's great in this movie.....i can totally see tom cruise playing himself in this one. either way...i suppose i liked it.....the movie had it's moments.

Driving Miss Daisy--1990                              (7/30/2007)         
                       Meeh. didn't really see what the big deal was. it was okay...some parts i laughed out loud...
Dances With Wolves--1991                  (1991)
                     yeah like we really want to see your butt again Kevin Costner.....put that thing away. ewww. no thank you! i did really like this movie though. it had it's good parts and i liked it on a historical level too. i think that i like it more for the indian chief than kevin costner though. 

Silence Of The Lambs--1992                  (1998?)
                    Uh, okay. Anthony Hopkins was good and i liked that guy who was making the body suit. i think i liked this one mostly because i was a murder mystery involving serial killers. i have a strange fascination with them, don't really know why but i really just can't help it. i suppose it's because they do things that i could never ever do....maybe?

Unforgiven--1993                        (1998?)
                         Uh, western with clint eastwood...that 's all i really remember. Oh and something about hookers and a rape. Other than that?

Schindler's List--1994                            (8/15/2007)
                            I finally watched it! You don't know how long i had it sitting by my dvd player! For daaaaays! ahhhh! I thought that it was going to be alot more depressing than it was....but it was a lot tamer than i though it was going to be....i think that just comes from seeing soooo much violence already....you know....i mean i even said it before.....the fact that seeing someones head get blown off doesn't really jar me as much as it should.....i've become desensitized to a certain degree. And while the whole thing is horrific...i kinda viewed it with a certain..i dunno...detachment. The only time that i got really teary eyed was at the end when schindler breaks down and when you got to see all the actual survivors and their acting counterparts. That part touched me, that he was able to save so many people is astounding itself. I mean this is another one of those epic movies that was basically ensured the oscar......i don't think that other movies even had a chance. The story was great and the acting too....and oh black and white! i love you! Except throughout the whole movie...i kept thinking how long it must have taken them to set up all that lighting.....it must have taken forever! i love limn lighting by the way... i think it's my favorite. But i think the reason i liked this movie that most is because of the lighting and the cinematography.....and it's not something that i would want to watch often....i think it would just depress me. I can and do appreciate it for what it is though. Oh i did like that little effect with the girls dress tho' and finding out later that it was actually one of Schindler's personal memories.....at first i was a little put off by it...i think i just hate things where kids are spotlighted in that way....i mean i can understand why....well kinda....i think i would understand more it i actually had kids. but anyway it was made more poignant for me by knowing it was an actual memory.

Forrest Gump--1995                  (1995)
                      you would not believe how many times this movie is quoted to me because my name is Jenni. so not funny anymore. and it anyone ever used that as a pick up line they are basically dead where they stand. Still i did really like this movie. it was cute and interesting how they were able to incorporate Forrest's life with actual history. i never really liked robin wright penn as jenny though....i don't know why. she just irked me for some reason.

Braveheart--1996                           (1996)
                   I have the soundtrack to this movie...mostly because i like that one song that has the bagpipe playing. I think it's just that funeral song though....plus i like that one girls theme song too. Anywho...i like this one. Even though it has Mel Gibson in it an all....but then he never really bothered me that much...even now. I mean i know he's a little crazy...but that doesn't seem to affect his movie making skills. I thought this one was a good movie all around...story-good, cinematography-good, costumes-good. acting-good too. Violence, didn't bother me. I only say that because even though all his movies are uber-violent...it's realistic to me, cause that's probably how it really was back whenever. The Patriot...that was the only one i didn't really like...and well never saw Passion so....yeah. Anyway....I know i probably cried while watching this and will probably yet again when i watch it for a refresher...can't help myself...i'm easy like that.

The English Patient--1997                            (8/16/2007)
                        Meeh. I dont' think that i am going to watch this one again.....i mean...i dunno. it was good i suppose. I did like all the parallel scenes in the film...which actually escape me now......oh like that one where juliette binoche and naveen andrews are kissing and it's matched with ralph finnes and kristin scott thomas......well i think you know what i mean if you've seen the film...other than that....well i suppose that i liked the cinematography too....the story was interesting...thought i didn't think that it really needed to be that long. And i've never really been a believer in commiting adultery soo....yeah. not so much. i dunno i just wasn't really impressed by this one.....even now i am having difficulty remembering and i just watched it this morning......i did think throughout tho' that ralph finnes was i dunno.......a little creepy seeming. I really don't know what it is....but his character just seemed a little odd. Even juliette binoche's character seemed a little loony...but i suppose that everyone she loved dying had a little to do with that.....that's enough to make anyone a little mad. Willem Dafoe is always nice to see.....and i usually enjoy seeing him in whatever he does. Ehh. i think i need to find out what else was up that year...just to see if i think this was the best.

Titanic--1998                          (1998)
                       I know your going to think i'm uber-lame...but i actually like the titanic. Yeah i know. i even like the celine dion song.....sadder yet. i think it i recall correctly i saw this one at least twice while in theatres. I though this one was great all around too...good acting, cinematography, sets, special effects, etc. Plus i really do kinda like my friend Billy Zane. If you've never seen the phantom, watch it-it's a hoot. Anywho...yeah i after watching this one i even wanted one of those heart diamond necklaces....yeah i know. shut up! i even liked the way the movie ended...it was circuitous. (real word? ehh).

Shakespeare In Love--1999                        (1999)
                       A movie i actually liked Ben Affleck in.

American Beauty--2000                                   (2000)
                  Oh, movie. really like this one....lots of different reasons. i think mostly because kevin spacey's character goes through that crazy mid-life crisis. working on the guns, blackmailing his boss, smokin' the weed--crack me up. didn't really care to much for mena suvari or thora birch to much though. Wes bentley is a little hottie however.

Gladiator--2001                         (2001)
                         Eh, good the first time you watch it...but i don't really feel a pressing urge to watch it again. I think this is one of those boy movies again. i mean yeah...the story is interesting, but i don't really think that russell crowe is all that hot. so i mean really. i did think that the end with the little boy walking out with Maximus' body a little overboard...i mean isn't he a little too young to be picking him over his uncle? yeah i dunno. plus i really don't think that Maximus would have liked this family being buried in the arena like that....i mean couldn't you go find a nice field somewhere? really.

Beautiful Mind--2002                                  (8/19/2007)
                   Meeh. That's kinda what i gotta say...meeh. I mean it was good and i really like Jennifer Connelly, but eh. It was inspiring in the sense that it was based on actual events. Plus i do like Paul Bettany....he's got this weird charm that i find appealing. Watching this movie made me a little sad that i wasn't more brilliant. so not...oh well. Um.....i dunno..i really didn't like seeing Adam Goldberg in this movie...just cause his character is the same in all the movies he plays....the neurotic crazy type who like to talk with his hands and speaks in high pitched tones. So definitely not my favorite Ron Howard movie. I dont' really have any desire to watch it again. so yeah. that baby was really really cute tho'. umhmh....

Chicago--2003                            (2003)
                     Renee Zellweger..........waaay to pale in this movie. what a whitey.

Lord Of The Rings: Return Of The King--2004                     (2004)
                            i remember liking fellowship alot more than this one.
